medical_history.chief_complaint: 5 day history of abdominal pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began 5 days prior to admission, diffusely in the lower abdomen and increased in intensity 4 days prior to admission. Pain is intermittent and reaches 9 out of 10 in severity. Patient reports that the pain has remained unchanged in the last 4 days, does not radiate, and is worse when walking. Patient has had mild diarrhea throughout the past 5 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Question of irritable bowel syndrome; anxiety; acid reflux (does not take regular medication for it); EGD performed. History of nonspecific gastrointestinal symptoms including nausea and irritation of lips when consuming bread, negative for celiac disease.
